content.title: Scholarship Scheme For Disabled Students To Study Abroad For Higher Education
content.details: Scholarships are to be provided to twelve students every year by the Department of Social Justice proposed. So scholarship is provided to 2-2 orthopedically disabled students, 2-2 hearing impaired students and 2-2 visually impaired students of postgraduate level courses in specific fields abroad for a research degree (PhD) and to provide financial assistance to participate in research programs after the research degree.
benefits: Scholarship for Higher Education in abroad
eligibility: Applicants should be natives of Madhya Pradesh
Applicants should have 40% or more disability
Applicant's age should not be more than 35 years
For studies after research degree - First class or 60% marks or its equivalent grade in the relevant postgraduate examination and research degree (PhD) with experience in the relevant field

For Research Degree (PhD) - First class or 60% marks in the relevant postgraduate examination or its equivalent grade and two years teaching/research/professional experience in the relevant field/M. Phil. degree
For Post Graduate Degree - First Class in Bachelor's Degree or 60% marks or its equivalent grade
The applicant's name should be registered on the Sparsh portal
The annual income of applicant's family should be up to Rs. 96,000
One Child per family will be eligible only at once
content.application_process: Applicants have to visit the official website and download the application form. Fill out the application with the necessary information. Attach the required documents. Application in the prescribed form will have to be submitted to the District Office of Social Justice and Disabled Welfare.

faqs.answer: Applicants should be natives of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: What Is Disability Eligible Criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicants should have 40% or more disability.

faqs.question: What Is Financial Eligible Criteria?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the applicant's family should be up to Rs. 96,000.

faqs.question: How many students will be eligible?
faqs.answer: Scholarships are to be provided to twelve students every year by the Department of Social Justice proposed.

faqs.question: What documents are required while submitting the application form?
faqs.answer: Disability Certificate, Domicile Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Medical Certificate, Income Certificate.

faqs.answer: Visit the official website and download the application form.
